edu.rice.starvote.util

Class GPIOListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rice.starvote.util.GPIOListener

  • public class GPIOListener
extends java.lang.Object

    Handles hardware interrupts for a GPIO input pin. Makes Pi4J GPIO interrupts easier to use. Allows efficient event-driven control of software by GPIO sensors, rather than polling.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

    • Constructor Detail

      • GPIOListener

        public GPIOListener(int pin)

        Constructor. Initializes the given pin for GPIO digital input.

        Parameters:
        pin - Pin to listen for hardware interrupts (BCM numbering).

    • Method Detail

      • waitForEvent

        public boolean waitForEvent(com.pi4j.io.gpio.PinEdge edge,
                            java.lang.Runnable task)

        Register an event handler to execute once the next time the pin state changes in the desired direction. This method blocks indefinitely until the event occurs, or it is interrupted. The listener does not persist after first execution; subsequent events will not trigger it.

        Note that since this method only blocks until the event occurs, the event handler task itself may run concurrently with the parent thread. Be careful to implement additional synchronization if concurrency is not desired.

        Parameters:
        edge - Direction of state change to listen for: RISING, FALLING, or BOTH.
        task - Task to execute when event is detected.
        Returns:
        True if event occured, false if interrupted while waiting.

      • waitForEvent

        public boolean waitForEvent(com.pi4j.io.gpio.PinEdge edge,
                            java.lang.Runnable task,
                            long timeout)

        Register an event handler to execute once the next time the pin state changes in the desired direction. This method blocks until the event occurs, the timeout expires, or it is interrupted. The listener does not persist after first execution; subsequent events will not trigger it.

        Note that since this method only blocks until the event occurs, the event handler task itself may run concurrently with the parent thread. Be careful to implement additional synchronization if concurrency is not desired.

        Parameters:
        edge - Direction of state change to listen for: RISING, FALLING, or BOTH.
        task - Task to execute when event is detected.
        timeout - Time to wait in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        True if event occured, false if timeout expired or interrupted.

      • getState

        public com.pi4j.io.gpio.PinState getState()

        Get current state of pin.

        Returns:
        Pin state. LOW or HIGH.
